intro: Cacalia fastigiata, commonly known as the upright cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet, featuring slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pale blue to violet, with a central disc surrounded by ray florets. Cacalia fastigiata is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
